> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19889?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [1e4c50a...c81ec57](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19889?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Unfortunately I recently switched to a new environment (Ubuntu app on Windows) and am having some trouble running `asv continuous` (conda related setup issue I think). Here were some `%timeit`s I was able to run in the meantime.

```
This Branch 

In [1]: from pandas import *

In [2]: from datetime import *

In [3]: %timeit Timestamp('2017-08-25 08:16:14')
2.6 µs ± 89.8 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100000 loops each)

In [4]: %timeit Timestamp(datetime(2000, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6))
1.67 µs ± 37.6 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000000 loops each)

In [6]: %timeit Timestamp(year=2000, month=1, day=2, hour=3, minute=4, second=5, microsecond=6)
3.05 µs ± 88.7 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100000 loops each)

In [9]: import pytz

In [10]: %timeit Timestamp(2000, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, pytz.UTC)
3.32 µs ± 130 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100000 loops each)

Master

In [1]: import pytz

In [2]: from pandas import *

In [3]: from datetime import *

In [4]: %timeit Timestamp('2017-08-25 08:16:14')
2.48 µs ± 60.6 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100000 loops each)

In [5]: %timeit Timestamp(datetime(2000, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6))
2.08 µs ± 44.3 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100000 loops each)

In [6]: %timeit Timestamp(year=2000, month=1, day=2, hour=3, minute=4, second=5, microsecond=6)
3.57 µs ± 84.1 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100000 loops each)

In [8]: %timeit Timestamp(2000, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, pytz.UTC)
3.38 µs ± 57 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100000 loops each)
```
